name.japanese: ロストアイランドの地下遺跡

description: Ancient underground ruins discovered beneath the dome-shaped building on Lost Island. The ruins contain ceiling paintings depicting Sennenryu dragons and evidence of an ancient royal court. The ground collapsed, revealing this hidden archaeological site.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Underground Ruins
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates fall into the underground ruins when the ground collapses beneath them, revealing this ancient site.
keyEvents.significance: This location contains the key to solving the mystery of the Dragon's Nest location.

keyEvents.title: Ancient Sennenryu Paintings Discovered
keyEvents.description: The ruins contain ancient ceiling paintings depicting Sennenryu dragons, providing historical evidence of their existence.
keyEvents.significance: These paintings help the crew deduce the true location of the Dragon's Nest.

keyEvents.title: Zoro vs Eric Battle
keyEvents.description: Zoro confronts and battles Eric in the underground ruins to protect the crew and buy them time to escape.
keyEvents.significance: The ruins serve as the battleground for this important confrontation.

statusHistory.reason: The ruins were hidden underground and undiscovered
Ruins revealed when the ground collapsed

description: An island in the East Blue initially believed to be the location of the Dragon's Nest. The Straw Hats discover it was actually the site of an ancient royal court mentioned in historical stories. The island features a mountain with a dome-shaped building at its peak.

keyEvents.title: Identified as Ancient Royal Court
keyEvents.description: The crew realizes Lost Island was the ancient royal court from Bokuden's stories, not the Dragon's Nest.
keyEvents.significance: This revelation corrects their understanding of the island's historical significance.

statusHistory.reason: Island is accessible and explored by the crew

description: An island in the East Blue that is home to Apis and her grandfather. This island is revealed to be the true location of the Dragon's Nest, which has since sunk beneath the ocean. The island rises from the sea approximately once every 1,000 years.

keyEvents.title: Revealed as True Dragon's Nest Location
keyEvents.description: Nami deduces that Warship Island was the actual location of the Dragon's Nest, though it has now sunk beneath the sea.
keyEvents.significance: This is the major revelation of the episode that solves the central mystery of the arc and sets up the journey back to Warship Island.
